meanings.definition: To break down into small particles or components.
meanings.sent1: The blender atomises the fruits into a smoothie.
meanings.sent2: The scientist atomises the substance to study its composition.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand atomises the rock into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent4: The storm atomises the sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The laser beam atomises the metal, creating a fine mist.

meanings.sent1: The explosion atomises the building into rubble.
meanings.sent2: The nuclear reactor atomises the uranium for energy production.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power can atomise any object with a touch.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seems to atomise colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The potion has the ability to atomise matter into nothingness.

meanings.sent1: The acid atomises the paper, leaving no trace behind.
meanings.sent2: The virus atomises the cell, causing it to burst.
meanings.sent3: The evil villain's weapon can atomise entire cities in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat can atomise the ice sculpture in minutes.
meanings.sent5: The powerful earthquake can atomise buildings into dust.
